column5: Any one here owns a stradic 4000 MGFA??  I just purchased one and wantting to hear if anyone here came to trouble with some parts of the reel. Thx Sammy
a friend has the 2500mgfa.. he says its an amazing reel and wouldent change his. damnn expensive but nice you should post some pics of your new baby
You can't go wrong with a Stradic!!!
It's a real nice reel. The drag is awesome just as with any stradic and it is so so so light. Beautiful reel.
You bought a great reel for sure.  Congrats on the purchase.
Played with a Stradic 2500 at BPS. SWEET REEL!!! Unfortunately out of my price range. I settled for a Sahara.

I have 2 Stradic 4000's & a 2000 . . . . .     likely the best reels for the money there is! I also have 2 Sustain 4000's, also super reels . . .  but twice the money, and NOT twice as good! I've hauled in everything from crappies to carp, salmon & 'bows with ease . . . .    you absolutely cannot go wrong with this reel. Matter of fact, I'm picking up a big ol' Stradic 6000 from Fishing World in Hamilton next trip down . . . .    just a toy to play with the salmon & carp . . . .     and I think its big enough that I could bolt it on the back of my van & tow cars! Enjoy!
HAHA...  What if i get a stella 20000?~~ hehe..... I wish the salmon season starts soon!! Miss the action so much... hands are starting to get ichy~~ lol

I had the pleasure of fondling a Stella a few years ago . . . .      a retired gent had a beauty of a 13' custom trout rod, with 'Stella' attached . . . .     he let me land about a 3 pound 'bow with it . . . . .     THAT is one nice reel! Way y y  y  y out of my price range . . . .     I'll 'make do' with the cheap stuff! Hell . . .  the fish don't know anyway!
